pros: Get to work with cool tech
cons: Job doesn't have downsides that I have encountered

pros: Area, location, some of the people
cons: Pay, contract, manager, and all that

pros: Fantastic campus and a great location.
cons: Didn’t like some parts of the course.

pros: Good IT kit. Nothing else was positive
cons: You mention your current salary in your application, yet they have the audacity to offer you even lower and expect you to move to Penryn.

pros: People who do the day-to-day work of working with students are by in large talented, good souls with their hearts in the right place doing good work.
cons: The University, if it could still be called that with its "...ambitious 2030 Strategy, ‘Doing it for Real’, is designed to deliver yet further growth in our student numbers and income through portfolio diversification, innovation, research and commercial ventures. It will establish Falmouth as the market leader for creative industries and entrepreneurship education over the next decade, capitalising on our considerable assets in innovation-led research and business incubation." overworks, underpays, and devalues the good work that people do. The senior management making six-figure salaries are on a mission to wring profit out of students and staff any way they can. Overcharge, underpay, overwork, set up shady subsidiary companies to hire new faculty and pay them less, outright lie... whatever it takes to boost the profits and prestige of the university. This from a public institution that receives public funding. The goal of a public education institution seems no longer to be to educate.

review_title: Good low commitment opportunity for busy students
job_title: Digital Experience Consultant in Falmouth, England
pros: Easy way to earn money Low commitment Friendly staff Project management experience
cons: The jobs aren't very frequent, and even when they pop up its not guaranteed you'll be chosen to give feedback.

review_title: What a great place to work
pros: Fabulous environment, wonderful students, and great management support
cons: Make parking on-site difficult and expensive. It was all a bit prescriptive as to who could park or not park on the grounds.

pros:
Laidback approach
Hybrid working if wanted
cons:

Little progression
Access to software lacking

job_title: Course Leader and Lecturer in Falmouth, England
pros: Forward thinking, creative industries focussed HE establishment with strong links to the arts and commerce at a national and international level.
cons: Has issues attracting a significantly diverse student /staff body because of its location in far south west of the country. It works very hard to change this perception to build an inclusive community with a global outlook.

pros: Great colleagues, access to various support, good pay, defined benefit pension (no longer offered), satisfying when working with engaged students
cons: Aggressive targets mean having to accept students who aren't appropriate and then bending over backwards to make them stay, desperate clamouring for their cash is vile, top management are sickening in heavy handed enforcement of arbitrary policy and ruling with cruelty

review_title: Arbitrary, short sighted and not student centered
pros: Academic staff doing the work are skilled and conscientious. They give their all, and then some. Some creative thinkers and problem solvers who are great to work with have worked here. Unfortunately, they leave.
cons: Previous reviews about upper management, especially arbitrary and capricious decision making, are spot on. There is a rigid hierarchy, rife with bullying, that makes decisions based what is trendy and brings in money. Money is the bottom line. Salary for rank and file staff/faculty is poor while salary for upper management is quite high. The student comment about feeling like there is a policy to not give marks over 80% is more than a feeling. It is actual policy that assessment boards enforce. Thinking is rigid and inflexible and very much taboo to challenge. If you dare to challenge you will be subjected to gaslighting and bullying.

job_title: Senior Lecturer In Digital Journalism in Falmouth, England
pros: This was a positive employment experience, though short. There was a feeling of positivity on campus. The staff team were good, knowledgeable and respectful.
cons: Poor forward planning resulted in a department being downsized and with subsequent redundancies. This was avoidable. The common factor of the person at the top being a little out of step with the team delivering the teaching and not sharing their own vision for the department. Poor communication between the department, though this wasn't across the university as a whole as far as I'm aware.

pros:
working with students
the campus
the colleagues
cons: senior management - too much group think!

job_title: IT Support Officer in Falmouth, England
pros: Great work ethic, nice people, generous holiday.
cons: Pay should be better for everyone.

pros: Amazing people, incredible opportunities, and friendly atmosphere. Great support provided during the pandemic with equipment provided for home working and wellbeing support.
cons: Not many. They could improve on the dissemination of communication and collaboration between departments and academic areas.

pros: Great campus in Cornwall. Creative facilities
cons: Zero Mental health support for employees, verging on bullying.

review_title: Great staff and students, terrible executive management
pros: Talented, dedicated and hard-working staff, sparky students, good campus facilities, beautiful location. Management at department level is mostly very good.
cons: The executive management of the university is extremely poor. Constant restructuring causes ongoing confusion and uncertainty, and is typically undertaken with little or no consultation among the people who will be affected by it . Stress levels among staff are very high; many staff feel that they are not listened to and that their experience is not valued. Staff who raise questions with executive management tend not to last very long in their jobs.

pros:
Relaxed Friendly Working environment, Usual staff benefits associated with Working at a University,  Great Library and IT Team Staff are inspiring and dedicated.
Lovely location and grounds.
cons:
Not really got many, the pay is below average for IT support within a university. 
IT and the library were outsourced top fxPlus in 2012/13, FXplus is a charity setup to run the day to day needs of a joint campus (Following a different pay scale)

pros: They give you lots of opportunities for fun activities and work around your schedule.
cons: It's under appreciated by the majority of the student body.
